text: colloids are mixtures of two or more

composed of compounds in different
states

the solvent portion of the colloid is
called a continuous phase the solid
portion of the colloid is called
dyspersed phase now when water is the
solvent classification occurs in two
ways
why would philocaloids are those
colloids that have strong attractions
between continuous and dispersed phases
examples include protein and water which
is found in blood protein is the dice
first phase water is the continuous
phase and they mix very well
phobic colloids are those colloids that
lack attraction between continuous and

fat and water mixtures we know that fat
the disperse phase and water continuous

now there are two ways to fill uh filter
colloids the first way is by Heating and
then filtration if you heat a colloid
this will cause the solute to coagulate
and then you could filter it by simple
filtration the second way is via
dialysis dialysis is the separation
using a semi-permeable membrane for
example you have a semi-probial membrane
here red blood cells mixed with water
the red blood cells are the dice first

water will flow easily from one side to
